## Accessing IMAGO Data Products

This page provides guidance on how to access and download the IMAGO data products for this training.

Where to Access the Data

All IMAGO datasets for this release can be accessed and downloaded from the following website:

https://imago.ac.uk/data

The website hosts all available files along with supporting documentation.

## Available Data Formats

The data products are provided in multiple formats to support different analytical needs:

- CSV (.csv) – Tabular data suitable for use in most statistical and data analysis software.
- GeoPackage (.gpkg) – A spatial data format compatible with GIS software such as QGIS and ArcGIS.
- Metadata files – Documentation describing variables, measurement units, methodologies, and data sources.

## Included Data for This Release

The current IMAGO data release includes the following thematic datasets:

Temperature – Measures of temperature patterns across regions.

Pollution – Indicators of air quality and pollution exposure.

Flooding – Flood risk and flood-related environmental measures.

Sun probability measure – A spatial metric capturing probability of sunlight exposure.

## Metadata Information

Metadata is provided alongside each dataset and includes rich information on variable descriptions, definitions, spatial and temporal coverage, data provenance and methodology.

## File structure and format details

Data users are encouraged to consult the metadata before working with the datasets, as it provides essential context for interpretation and analysis.

## Downloading the Data

Simply visit the IMAGO data page, browse the available datasets, and download the files in your preferred format. You will need to create an account on the IMAGO website before downloading the data. Once logged in, you can browse the available datasets and download the files in your preferred format.

If you have questions about accessing or interpreting the data, please get in touch with us (imago@liverpool.ac.uk).
